Items.Title: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) rapped the gavel three times and stated:
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) then stated:
Items.AgendaNote: "Will the Clerk please read the call for today's Charter Meeting."
Items.MinutesNote: "Will the Clerk please read the call for today's Charter Meeting?"

Items.Title: The City Clerk and Clerk of the Council, the Honorable Victor L. Robles, read the following:
The Public Advocate then stated:
Items.AgendaNote: "Pursuant to Section 42 of the New York City Charter, I hereby call this meeting to order and direct the City Clerk and the Clerk of the Council to read the communication from the Board of Elections stating the list of elected City Council Members."
Items.MinutesNote: "Pursuant to Section 42 of the New York City Charter, I hereby call this meeting to order and direct the City Clerk and the Clerk of the Council to read the communication from the Board of Elections stating the list of elected City Council Members."

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Rose Gill Hearn to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her appointment as Commissioner of Investigation, pursuant to Section 31 of the New York City Charter.
Items.MatterName: Rose Gill Hearn, Appointment, Commissioner of Investigation

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor (Rudolph W. Giuliani) - Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 262-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the suspension of alternate side of the street parking rules on the religious holidays of Purim and Ash Wednesday.
Items.MatterName: Veto of Int. No. 262-A, Parking,  Alternate Side Suspension Purim etc.,

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor (Rudolph W. Giuliani) - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 723,  A Local Law to amend the Administrative Code of the City of New York, in relation to the acceptance of campaign contributions subsequent to the date of election from previous contributors for the purpose of debt repayment.
Items.MatterName: Veto of Int. No. 723, Campaign contributions, debt repayment

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor (Rudolph W. Giuliani) - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 968,  A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the licensing of newsstands.
Items.MatterName: Veto of Int. No. 968, Licensing of newsstands

Items.Title: The Public Advocate  then stated:
Items.AgendaNote: "Will the City Clerk and the Clerk of the Council perform the formal ceremony of the duly elected Council Members taking their oath of office."
Items.MinutesNote: "Will the City Clerk and the Clerk of the Council perform the formal ceremony of the duly elected Council Members taking their oath of office?"

Items.Title:
January 1, 2002

Honorable Victor L. Robles
City Clerk and Clerk of the Council
265 Municipal Building
New York, New York  10007

Dear City Clerk Robles:

Pursuant to Section 42 of the New York City Charter, the Charter meeting of the 2002 Council of the city of New York will be held on Wednesday, January 9, 2002 at 12:00 noon, in the Council Chambers, second floor, City Hall, New York, New York.

Sincerely,

Betsy Gotbaum
Public Advocate
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council

Items.Title:
January 1, 2002

Honorable Victor L. Robles
City Clerk and Clerk of the Council
265 Municipal Building
New York, New York 10007

Dear City Clerk Robles:

Please be hereby advised that the following named persons were elected Members of the City Council of New York on November 6, 2001:

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Roll Call
The Clerk read:
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) then requested:
Items.AgendaNote: "Will the Clerk call the Roll for the purpose of ascertaining the presense of a quorum."
Items.MinutesNote: "Will the Clerk call the Roll for the purpose of ascertaining the presence of a quorum?"

Items.Title: Roll Call
The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) then stated:
Items.AgendaNote: "Please rise for today's invocation given by Rabbi Jonathan Glass of the Civic Center Synagogue."
Items.MinutesNote: "Please rise for today's Invocation given by Rabbi Jonathan Glass of the Civic Center Synagogue."

Items.Title: Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York 10013.

The Public Advocate will recognize Council Member Gerson.

Council Member Gerson will make the motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record.

The Public Advocate states:
"If there be no objections, it is so ordered."
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York 10013.

The Public Advocate (Ms. Gerson) recognized Council Member Gerson.

Council Member Gerson moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) states:
"If there be no objections, it is so ordered.

Items.Title: Messages and Papers from the Mayor
The Public Advocate stated:
Items.AgendaNote: "I order the call to be Received, Ordered, Printed and Filed."
Items.MinutesNote: "I order the call to be Received, Ordered, Printed and Filed."

Items.Title: The Public Advocate stated:
Items.AgendaNote: "I order this communication to be Received, Ordered, Printed and Filed."
Items.MinutesNote: "I order this communication to be Received, Ordered, Printed and Filed."

Items.AgendaNote:
After ascertaining from the Clerk that there is a quorum, the Public Advocate will then announce:
"We have a quorum."

Items.MinutesNote: At the request of the Speaker (Council Member Miller), the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the meeting to be in recess.

Items.Title: Nomination and Election of he Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Nomination and Election of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections

Items.Title: Nomination of the Speaker
Items.ActionText: This Petition was Approved, by Council

Items.Title: Communication from the Republican Members of the Council - Designating and appointing James S. Oddo as Minority Leader of the New York City Council for a term commencing on January 1, 2002.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: James S. Oddo, Appointment, Minority Leader of the Council

Items.Title: The Adoption of the continuation of the 1998-2001 Rules of the Council, as amended.
Items.ActionText: This Petition was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: The Adoption of the continuation of the 1998-2001 Rules of the Council, as amended.

Items.MinutesNote: The newly-elected Speaker (Council Member Miller) delivered his acceptance speech.

The following motion was made by Council Member Comrie: 

Motion that pursuant to Section 46 of the New York City Charter, the 1998-2001 Rules of the Council as amended, be continued and in effect until new rules shall be adopted or said rules shall be otherwise amended or modified.  

The nomination was seconded by Council Member Moskowitz.

Council Member Rivera made a motion to nominate for  Speaker of the Council of the City of New York, pursuant to section 44 of the New York City Charter, for the term commencing January 1, 2002 and terminating December 31, 2003, Council Member A. Gifford Miller.

The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) asked if there were any more nominations from the floor.  There being no other nominations from the floor, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the nominations closed.

At this point, the Pubic Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) asked for a voice vote on Council Member Rivera's motion.  The motion unanimously carried in the affirmative.

The Speaker (Council Member Miller) made a motion to nominate the new members of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections:

Leroy G. Comrie, Chair
Bill Perkins
Madeline Provenzano
Christine C. Quinn
Joel Rivera
Tony Avella
Maria Baez
Yvette D. Clarke
Lewis A. Fidler
Melinda R. Katz
David I. Weprin
James S. Oddo
A. Gifford Miller
The Clerk administered the oath of office to all 51 Council Members.

After ascertaining from the Clerk that there is a quorum, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) announced: 

"We have a quorum."
